definition: fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
to rub
fist/boxing
to wipe/to erase/rubbing (brush stroke in painting)/to clean/to polish
palm of the hand/sole of the foot/paw/horseshoe/to slap/to hold in one's hand/to wield

sentences.english: The lawyers are, no doubt, rubbing their hands.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，律师们正摩拳擦掌，跃跃欲试。

sentences.english: Sometimes story, take on the piano chords try.
sentences.chinese: 有时也煞有介事，拿着简谱在钢琴上摩拳擦掌。

sentences.english: Is the US girding its loins for another great crusade against evil?
sentences.chinese: 美国是会为了再一次大举讨伐邪恶而摩拳擦掌？

definition: variant of 摩拳擦掌[mo1 quan2 ca1 zhang3]
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
lit. to sharpen one's sword (idiom)/fig. to prepare to attack/to be getting ready for battle
to begin to stir (idiom)/to get restless/to become threatening
impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
to be unable to hold back
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to showcase one's (unique) talents/to display one's (individual) prowess
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
unable to wait
cheering excitedly (idiom)/jubilant
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
having high fighting spirit
(idiom) fully displaying one's capabilities
aggressive and grand (idiom); ambitious/pushy
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
